html: Jehovah’s “day of vengeance” and “year of retribution” on behalf of Zion—his Day of Judgment—occur as a covenant curse upon the wicked who violate the rights of his elect: “I had resolved on a day of vengeance, and the year of my redeemed had come” (Isaiah 63:4; cf. 47:3-4; 59:17-18; 61:2). That day of vengeance is also the day of the king of Assyria/Babylon, whom Jehovah empowers to destroy the wicked (Isaiah 2:12; 7:17; 10:3-7; 13:6-13). Those who persecute Jehovah’s righteous people suffer the curses of the covenants he made with his people at the time he reverses their circumstances.
